calm
Pirlo English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 37 in today's
episode I have a new word for you at
Pease do you know what it means let's
find out what it means and how you can
use it in your daily conversation
appease you must have come across a
situation when your friends are arguing
with you over a situation or a demand to
be fulfilled you try to satisfy them by
giving in to their demands willingly or
unwillingly in short you are trying to
appease or satisfy them so basically the
word of peace means to calm or satisfy
someone by giving what is asked for or
needed either willingly or unwillingly
in other words when you give in to the
demands of someone to satisfy or calm
them you are trying to appease them
appease is a verb as it is an action of
satisfying or calming someone or a
situation okay now that you know what a
peace means let's have a look at some
example sentences to see how you can use
appease in your daily conversation
example 1 the most awaited big-budget
film of the year didn't appease the
audience because of its poor storyline
example 2 I don't understand how your
P's your angry boss each time please
teach me the trick
example three the father appeased his
naughty kids with some cookies instead
of taking them to the water park example
for sometimes store managers have to
give extra concessions to appease the
annoyed customers example five the
beautiful sunset appeased mary's anxiety
example 6 when you are on a diet the
best way to appease your hunger is by
having fruits example 7 the attorney
appeased his clients anxiety by assuring
him a positive outcome example 8 before
the final match the coach appeased the
players by giving a small pep talk
you
